description.narrative: National and sub-national capacity is increased for the provision and demand of timely essential health services for women, girls and boys affected by humanitarian situations, and emergency services are delivered, in line with the CCCs., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews (Covid), Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved access and increased utilization of quality and equity focused MNCH and immunization services for mothers, new born, U5 children and adolescent girls in most deprived provinces and areas

title.narrative: National and sub-national capacity is increased for the provision and demand of timely essential health services for women, girls and boys affected by humanitarian situations, and emergency services are delivered, in line with the CCCs.

description.narrative: UNICEF ensured the continuity of essential RMNCAH services reaching over 250,000 women, children and adolescents with critical medical and personal protective supplies, and other services. In addition, over 150,000 affected children and 30,000 women benefited from essential health services and health education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/07/2020

title.narrative: UNICEF-targeted children 6-59 months in humanitarian situations who are vaccinated against measles
